title: Grammys 2025 Red Carpet: Chappell Roan, Taylor Swift, Billie Eilish, Charli XCX, and More
description: Don’t miss what Kaytranada, St. Vincent, A. G. Cook, and more wear to Music’s Biggest Night
author: Chris Panicker, Matthew Strauss
excerpt: Don’t miss what Kaytranada, St. Vincent, A. G. Cook, and more wear to Music’s Biggest Night
text: Don’t miss what Kaytranada, St. Vincent, A. G. Cook, and more wear to Music’s Biggest NightChappell Roan, February 2025 (Kevin Mazur/Getty Images for The Recording Academy)The 2025 Grammy Awards are today at Los Angeles’ Crypto.com Arena. Among the stars in attendance are nominees and performers Billie Eilish, Charli XCX, Chappell Roan, and Doechii. Fellow nominees like Taylor Swift, Kaytranada, St. Vincent, and Arooj Aftab are also present for the proceedings. Comedian Trevor Noah will also get to the arena eventually to host the Grammy Awards for the fifth straight year.Stay tuned here to see photos of your favorite musicians on the Grammys’ red carpet, and head to YouTube to watch the Grammys’ official red carpet livestream, beginning at 6 p.m. Eastern.Catch up on Pitchfork’s 2025 Grammys coverage with takeaways from the nominations and predictions on who will win.Frazer Harrison/Getty ImagesAlaska Reid and A. html:
Don’t miss what Kaytranada, St. Vincent, A. G. Cook, and more wear to Music’s Biggest Night

The 2025 Grammy Awards are today at Los Angeles’ Crypto.com Arena. Among the stars in attendance are nominees and performers Billie Eilish, Charli XCX, Chappell Roan, and Doechii. Fellow nominees like Taylor Swift, Kaytranada, St. Vincent, and Arooj Aftab are also present for the proceedings. Comedian Trevor Noah will also get to the arena eventually to host the Grammy Awards for the fifth straight year.

Stay tuned here to see photos of your favorite musicians on the Grammys’ red carpet, and head to YouTube to watch the Grammys’ official red carpet livestream, beginning at 6 p.m. Eastern.

Catch up on Pitchfork’s 2025 Grammys coverage with takeaways from the nominations and predictions on who will win.

Matthew Strauss is a Long Island native and a graduate of Columbia University. He joined Pitchfork in 2013.
